review: I have one (not an Amazon purchase) and after reading a number of reviews, I have these comments:Chromecast seems most compatible with Android devices or the Chrome operating system. I use a Nexus 7 or an Acer Chromebook (IMO best choice for a standby internet home computer) to access the device. It doesn't surprise me that some users have problems with IOS or Windows - Google CHROMECAST, right?Once set up I have had NO problems watching YouTube movies or anything else on YouTube thru my HDTV. Do you have to think & choose and operate things to make sure you have or to manage a connection? Of course! This is WIFI stuff - we expect things to get a little quirky sometimes. I don't bother with Netflix or any other subscription service ... there's so much out there gratis. There are Chromecast compatible internet radio apps. IHeart is planning compatibility soon. Pandora is compatible. Connect your TV to your sound system & enjoy for only $35.
